summary: An analyst has warned that bitcoin short leveraged positions are vulnerable as the digital asset surpasses the $43,000 mark.
title: Bitcoin bears face short squeeze risk as price rises above $44,000, analyst says
content: Analysts from Bitfinex pointed to two BTC price levels that have seen a significant amount of liquidations given the recent market volatility. "Currently we can see large short liquidations at $41,950, and then at $42,200," Bitfinex analysts told The Block.
Above these levels Bitfinex, the analysts said that the bitcoin price could experience "a bullish catapult" due to forced liquidations when shorts are forced to buy in order to close their trades.
Bitcoin was up as much as 5.3% on Tuesday, trading for $44,090 at 1:45 p.m. ET.
(Updates headline and story to show that bitcoin surpassed $44,000 on Tuesday.)
